reviewText:
Early Access Review

What do I think of Break_In?

Well... I will do what I usually do and describe my experience within the game.

Ive been playing this during the pre-alpha stages (from the demo up) and I have seen the placeholder weapons go to good looking pieces of art. But more importantly I have felt the joy and challange of trying to get enough money to buy the next safe house, and upgrade my gear. After 3 hours of constant heisting (suprisingly for an Early Access this was very stable) I neared my goal of a cabin in the woods.... Then the developer comes on for some testing"... Whose base does he use for the testing... thats right mine... I come back with next to no money left I cry for a bit and ask the developer if he has been the one raiding my base...

Turns out he had been... Armed with this knowledge (and thats about it seeing as I couldnt afford the supressed pistol I begin a series of raids on the developers base... This goes really well I got up to almost $28 000
date:
then he added land mines to the game... Being blissfully unaware I have probably died too many times to those damn land mines and I slowly gave all the money I stole back... after 10 hours of playing how much money do I have? Dont ask!

... $86....

Not 86K

$86...

I Love this game's idea and potential
recommended: I also love it at the moment it is a Early Access in the spirit of Prison Architect or Kerbal Space Program
hoursPlayed:
where the game is rapidly developed and is most definatly playable (even though both of those had a team and the Developer here is working alone)

My only problem with him is that in our many discussions he has not yet figured out the point of DLCs... he has this weird idea that they are meant to be expansions on the finished game... Not little things that make the game playable or that provide one or two features... This focus on a good game over income and on customer satisfaction make me think this guy is one of the good ones.

I hope you can give this game a go an please if I rob your base... its cause im poor
voteText:
I have a family to feed.

10/10
Since you have no proof of my failed base raids."
votesFunny: 37 of 47 people (79%) found this review helpful 12 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Break_in review....
Break_in is a game in which you earn money by raiding other players bases and stealing their cash, Whilst dodging the security (If they have any). Its like clash of clans in a way. You earn money by doing so then you can purchase different safe houses, Weapons, Security and equiptment. This game has huge replayability and the sweet feeling of seeing your money go up from 0 to rich. The community is great with the devs who are very nice and reply within 1 minute.
Overall this game has huge potential and is very good for a game released 2 days ago. There are alot of new things coming so I would advise you to get it. £6.29 ? Bargain... overall i give this 10/10 one of the best games I've played

Early Access Review

I liked the idea behind this game. The developer, from what I know is/was trying to make this game solo (or close to it). it hasn't really devloped much at all since I've bought it and as things stand, this isn't really a properly functioning game.

Because I gave this game a fair chance over time, I don't qualify for my money back but I wouold warn others into staying away from this one. It sells for 10 Euro as an early access project but it isn't even worth 1 Euro for me.

Solid No from me.  1/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The concept was good. Game was updated a couple of times until June 2015. We were supposed to get news about another update somewhere around new year.

We're nearing middle of February 2016. Still no news.

Welp, guess we can call that one...broken_in.
Do you see that Payday 2 pun...DO YOU SEE IT?!
tl;dr I wouldn't buy the game in its current state unless developer actually posts any update on its current situation.

01/05/2016 - UPDATE

We've seen last update on 23rd of March and developer stated that he didn't forget about the game blah blah blah rewrite blah blah release blah etc.

It's May. No updates, no announcements, nothing. I've seen the dev himself launch his game once or twice, but...uhh...that's about it. No release date. Maybe someone did a small BREAK IN to his house and stole the source code?

My guess is that dev looked at his game twice, shook his head in disappointment and forgot about the project once again. He didn't want to BREAK the problem INto pieces.

And I can sure bet my ♥♥♥ he'll remove me from his friendlist yet again for the sarcastic jibes.

UPDATE 2 - SAME DAY

I decided to look at game's store page.

There we have this:
Originally posted by Early Access:Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?
“9-12 months, approximately.”
Now look at the release date. Guess he'll be late to his own wedding.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Usually, I find no reason to review a game this early on. However after a single day with the game, I need to write the review I wish I could have read BEFORE deciding to purchase.

1. You do not decide what upgrade goes where.
Why does this matter? When attacking a structure that has upgraded, I already know where the cameras are. I know where the guards are. I know how the landmines are places. Upgrades slow me down, but I can rob every target I hit 100% of the time after only a few trial and error runs. There is no cheeky battle of the wits between intruder and owner. This is without a doubt 'the' game killer right here, as it's the biggest feature that appeals to people (and myself).

2. High value targets pay the most, and can be robbed over and over.
Why does this matter? Well you'll find where the vault is, spam it until their bank is dry. You then become a high value target for someone else to do the exact same thing to. It is inherently broken and I do not see a way it can be fixed. There is no exception here.

These two problems alone loop endlessly back on eachother, as you will discover for yourself if you choose to play. I see this going one of two ways. Either enough people purchase to allow for a nearly full rebuild...or the game becomes an ironic vessel for heist-ing 10 dollars from my safe that I'll never see again (which I'm cool with, I love irony).

Oh ps dev, please remove the underscore in the name :P
voteText: 13 of 21 people (62%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE 3/24/16

CK has announced that today, he will be back on working on this game, but my hopes are far, far from high. There's been a lot of drama on the forums (and lack of consistent posting in said forums, mind you), that it seems that CK can't really take criticism all that well. I've seen a user, named Yandere Snake, write an ironic review about the game. Now, ironic reviews are not the best thing in the world when it comes to game criticism, I'll admit that much, but there's some pieces that CK could've taken from it. Now, you think the developer would be the more mature person in an argument like this, however, CK decided to make his profile private after the whole fiasco, and lock Yandere Snake's thread talking about when the next update is. Oh, he also probably locked it also due to the fact he's playing Final Fantasy a lot.

Honestly, I don't think I can trust a developer who can't take criticism like this. If you've heard of Garry's Incident: Day One, this is basically it. The devs could not take the criticism and censored the community's reviews, videos, and the like. They didn't improve themselves off it, but rather censor and claim that they're still great. It's a shame.

I have a bit of hope that maybe CK might change his ways, but I honestly would not bet on it.

UPDATE 3/25/16

Recently, I have been invited to a test group with the developer, so it seems like he's kicking into gear. Also, he's been giving a couple of the users in the community some communication about what's going on. Although, I'll have to leave this review as negative until I see the update.

UPDATE 4/30/16

Word straight from the horse's mouth, the update was supposed to drop around this month, considering when I asked CK0101, he kept telling me that he's planning to drop it a day closely to when I was asking, but in fact, I haven't seen this happen. I've asked about two times now and gotten that response, but the third time I asked, I didn't get any response at all. I have no idea what he's doing with the game, but whether or not he's actively or actually working on it, if a dev can't give a solid release date for their next update, they shouldn't give one at all. This is, of course, neverminding the break of communication and updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is one of the better early access games you will find!

I purchased this game because the unique concept really caught my attention. There is so much potential with this game to become a very big title later down the road.

As of writing this review, the game is still in early access so please keep that in mind before you purchase it. Yes, there are some bugs that still need to be worked out, but if you want to support the development of a promising game, then I cannot reccomend anything better than Break_In.

Pros -

• Stable Gameplay

• No Lag/Framerate Dips

• Very Community Minded Dev Team

• Amazing Game Concept

• Hours of adrenaline pumping gameplay.

Cons -

• Aside from a few early access bugs, nothing major.

*Pro Tip*

I highly reccomend starting out by buying the Silenced Pistol as it will make your theaving life much easier!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you have ever played The Castle Doctrine then that is essentially what this game is, but in a 3D FPS with a neat store system. I really enjoy the amount of ideas being put into the game, from land mines to hiring backup units. I just hope that this game gets what it deserves and doesnt become stale or deserted...Early access can be like that. The good thing is though, is that this game seems like it will hold its own and grow into something quite addicting and frustrating (The castle doctrine had periods in development where builders were able to make unbreakable bases, but this game seems to streamline the building and make it less do what ever you want" and does more a "you have these options
date: mix n match!". This game feels very much like the love child of PayDay 2 and The Castle Doctrine by Jason Rohrer.\n\nAlso for the hour I played I had a good time cracking safes
recommended: shooting derpy ai (that loudly exclaim semi-disappointedly "Theres someone here...") and standing at a PC for 5 minutes to make 500 bucks.\n\n7/10  - Will be Better with more patches. Hella fun even right now
voteText: August 5, 2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played been playing this since the demos and I really loved just about every moment I have spent playing. The game does have its issues but the developer seems to be working rather hard to get those ironed out as well as releasing new content and features. Even in its current state this game is a blast; Breaking into others bases and trying to get off with a reasonable amount of cash is really fun and has been rather quite interesting.
Overall I would give this game a 7/10 but with future content and updates this score will almost definitely go up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I have recently bought this game and please take into mind that these are my first impressions and will most probably change as the game develops. This review is as of the 0.05a update

So to make this review short this is a poor mans PayDay in the sense that you break into a place or a safe house in this case and can steal the money either by going in loud and making a lot of noise resulting in a special force of guards coming within 60-90 seconds depending what security the person you are robbing has hired. Maybe they dont have them at all.

So lets get onto the good things
-Nice audio. Everything sounds different depending if you are inside or outside
-Quite nice music
-Nice animations
-Stable FPS
-No game breaking glitches or bugs (I experience one but it wasn't that bad. It was just a minor set back.)
-Nice concept

Now lets go onto the bad things. Now this is a game in alpha so chances are there will be quite a lot of things that would be considered bad. These are things I personally don't find appealing or just don't like or some glitches bugs etc.

-Kind of crappy AI
-Knife isnt a one hit kill
-If backup is called its near impossible to make it out alive because they just keep coming
-Guards call for backup sometimes even though I just shot them in the head (Probably a bug/glitch)
-You don't get to choose where your defenses go (By this I mean if I wanted to place something in a certain place I cant. You can only place them in locations that have been picked by the dev)
-You start off with a lot of money meaning that you can upgrade your safe house pretty much to the max possible.

-Lack of tutorial in general. (It would be great if the game started you off by teaching you how to play and what to do, there should be some tutorial bases that you can rob and then use the money from it to start you off instead of starting with so much money.)

-Small amount of bases. (there is a small amount of bases that you can have and the layout is the same meaning if you play the game enough you will remember everything. Especially that the bases are quite small.)

-You cant design your own base.(so this kind of ties into the whole you cant choose where everything goes. It would be amazing if I could pick some rooms and place them however I want and then buy some cameras and place them where I want. It would be amazing if I could create the greatest safe house there is then test it out and if I can steal from it I should be able to set it as my safe house for others to try to break into. This would add replayability and add more variation to the game.)

-Cant open a Menu while trying to rob someone. (this seems like a big one because I cant turn down the music or sound or do whatever a menu should do.)

Overall the game isnt terrible. I wouldn't recommend buying it right now if you are expecting an amazing base building and robbery game. But if you want to support an indie game developer and make this game better I would totally recommend. It is definitely worth a buy if you have some cash to spare like I did and if you want a game that will help kill some time. I most probably just scratched the surface of this game and will be coming back to it but these are my initial thoughts. I will make sure to update this every couple of patches or so.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
